revised_title: The Impact of Pore-Water Tension on Clay Strength
tldr: This study investigates the influence of pore-water tension on the strength of clay. The researchers found that substantial pore-water tensions can control the mechanical behavior of unconfined clay samples, affecting their strength and brittleness. The results show a significant loss in strength when stress is released, and a dramatic change in brittleness due to high pore-water tensions. The findings have implications for soil sampling and testing in engineering projects.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Mechanics
